speech.line: For the which I will be thy adversary toward Anne Page. Said I well?

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: By gar, ’tis good; vell said.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Let us wag then.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Come at my heels, Jack Rugby.

scene.scenepersonae: (Evans, Simple, Page, Shallow, Slender, Host, Caius, Rugby)

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: I pray you now, good Master Slender’s servingman, and friend Simple by your name, which way have you look’d for Master Caius, that calls himself Doctor of Physic?

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: Marry, sir, the pittie-ward, the park-ward—every way; Old Windsor way, and every way but the town way.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: I most fehemently desire you you will also look that way.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: I will, sir.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Jeshu pless my soul! How full of chollors I am and trempling of mind! I shall be glad if he have deceiv’d me. How melancholies I am! I will knog his urinals about his knave’s costard when I have good opportunities for the ork. Pless my soul!
“To shallow rivers, to whose falls
Melodious birds sings madrigals;
There will we make our peds of roses,
And a thousand fragrant posies.
To shallow—”
Mercy on me! I have a great dispositions to cry.
“Melodious birds sing madrigals—
When as I sat in Pabylon—
And a thousand vagram posies.
To shallow, etc.”

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: Yonder he is coming, this way, Sir Hugh.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: He’s welcome.
“To shallow rivers, to whose falls—”
Heaven prosper the right! What weapons is he?

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: No weapons, sir. There comes my master, Master Shallow, and another gentleman—from Frogmore, over the stile, this way.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Pray you give me my gown, or else keep it in your arms.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: How now, Master Parson? Good morrow, good Sir Hugh. Keep a gamester from the dice, and a good studient from his book, and it is wonderful.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: Ah, sweet Anne Page!

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: God save you, good Sir Hugh!

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: God pless you from his mercy sake, all of you!

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: What? The sword and the word? Do you study them both, Master Parson?

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: And youthful still, in your doublet and hose, this raw rheumatic day?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: There is reasons and causes for it.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: We are come to you to do a good office, Master Parson.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Fery well; what is it?

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Yonder is a most reverend gentleman, who, belike having receiv’d wrong by some person, is at most odds with his own gravity and patience that ever you saw.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: I have liv’d fourscore years and upward; I never heard a man of his place, gravity, and learning, so wide of his own respect.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: What is he?

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: I think you know him: Master Doctor Caius, the renown’d French physician.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Got’s will, and his passion of my heart! I had as lief you would tell me of a mess of porridge.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Why?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: He has no more knowledge in Hibocrates and Galen—and he is a knave besides, a cowardly knave as you would desires to be acquainted withal.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: I warrant you, he’s the man should fight with him.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: O sweet Anne Page!

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: It appears so by his weapons. Keep them asunder; here comes Doctor Caius.

scene.stagedir: Evans and Caius offer to fight.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Nay, good Master Parson, keep in your weapon.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: So do you, good Master Doctor.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Disarm them, and let them question. Let them keep their limbs whole and hack our English.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: I pray you let-a me speak a word with your ear. Vherefore vill you not meet-a me?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Pray you use your patience in good time.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: By gar, you are de coward, de Jack dog, John ape.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Pray you let us not be laughing-stocks to other men’s humors. I desire you in friendship, and I will one way or other make you amends.
I will knog your urinals about your knave’s cogscomb for missing your meetings and appointments.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Diable! Jack Rugby—mine host de Jarteer—have I not stay for him to kill him? Have I not, at de place I did appoint?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: As I am a Christians-soul, now look you; this is the place appointed. I’ll be judgment by mine host of the Garter.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Peace, I say, Gallia and Gaul, French and Welsh, soul-curer and body-curer!

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Ay, dat is very good, excellant.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Peace, I say! Hear mine host of the Garter. Am I politic? Am I subtle? Am I a Machiavel? Shall I lose my doctor? No, he gives me the potions and the motions. Shall I lose my parson? My priest? My Sir Hugh? No, he gives me the proverbs and the no-verbs. Give me thy hand, terrestial; so. Give me thy hand, celestial; so. Boys of art, I have deceiv’d you both; I have directed you to wrong places. Your hearts are mighty, your skins are whole, and let burnt sack be the issue. Come, lay their swords to pawn. Follow me, lads of peace; follow, follow, follow.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: Afore God, a mad host. Follow, gentlemen, follow.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: O sweet Anne Page!

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Ha, do I perceive dat? Have you make-a de sot of us, ha, ha?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: This is well! He has made us his vlouting-stog. I desire you that we may be friends; and let us knog our prains together to be revenge on this same scall, scurvy, cogging companion, the host of the Garter.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: By gar, with all my heart. He promise to bring me where is Anne Page; by gar, he deceive me too.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Well, I will smite his noddles. Pray you follow.

scene.scenepersonae: (Mistress Page, Robin, Ford, Page, Shallow, Slender, Host, Evans, Caius, Rugby)

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Nay, keep your way, little gallant; you were wont to be a follower, but now you are a leader. Whether had you rather lead mine eyes, or eye your master’s heels?

speech.speaker: ROB.
speech.line: I had rather, forsooth, go before you like a man than follow him like a dwarf.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: O, you are a flattering boy, now I see You’ll be a courtier.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Well met, Mistress Page. Whither go you?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Truly, sir, to see your wife. Is she at home?

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Ay, and as idle as she may hang together, for want of company. I think if your husbands were dead, you two would marry.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Be sure of that—two other husbands.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Where had you this pretty weathercock?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: I cannot tell what the dickens his name is my husband had him of. What do you call your knight’s name, sirrah?

speech.speaker: ROB.
speech.line: Sir John Falstaff.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Sir John Falstaff!

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: He, he—I can never hit on ’s name. There is such a league between my goodman and he! Is your wife at home indeed?

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Indeed she is.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: By your leave, sir. I am sick till I see her.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Has Page any brains? Hath he any eyes? Hath he any thinking? Sure they sleep, he hath no use of them. Why, this boy will carry a letter twenty mile, as easy as a cannon will shoot point-blank twelve score. He pieces out his wive’s inclination; he gives her folly motion and advantage; and now she’s going to my wife, and Falstaff’s boy with her. A man may hear this show’r sing in the wind. And Falstaff’s boy with her! Good plots, they are laid, and our revolted wives share damnation together. Well, I will take him, then torture my wife, pluck the borrow’d veil of modesty from the so-seeming Mistress Page, divulge Page himself for a secure and willful Actaeon; and to these violent proceedings all my neighbors shall cry aim.

The clock gives me my cue, and my assurance bids me search—there I shall find Falstaff. I shall be rather prais’d for this than mock’d; for it is as positive as the earth is firm that Falstaff is there. I will go.

scene.stagedir: Enter Page, Shallow, Slender, Host, Evans, Caius, Rugby.

speech.speaker: SHAL., PAGE, ETC.
speech.line: Well met, Master Ford.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Trust me, a good knot. I have good cheer at home, and I pray you all go with me.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: I must excuse myself, Master Ford.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: And so must I, sir. We have appointed to dine with Mistress Anne, and I would not break with her for more money than I’ll speak of.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: We have linger’d about a match between Anne Page and my cousin Slender, and this day we shall have our answer.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: I hope I have your good will, father Page.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: You have, Master Slender, I stand wholly for you; but my wife, Master Doctor, is for you altogether.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Ay, be-gar, and de maid is love-a me. My nursh-a Quickly tell me so mush.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: What say you to young Master Fenton? He capers, he dances, he has eyes of youth; he writes verses, he speaks holiday, he smells April and May—he will carry’t, he will carry’t—’tis in his buttons—he will carry’t.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Not by my consent, I promise you. The gentleman is of no having. He kept company with the wild Prince and Poins; he is of too high a region, he knows too much. No, he shall not knit a knot in his fortunes with the finger of my substance. If he take her, let him take her simply. The wealth I have waits on my consent, and my consent goes not that way.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: I beseech you heartily, some of you go home with me to dinner. Besides your cheer, you shall have sport; I will show you a monster. Master Doctor, you shall go, so shall you, Master Page, and you, Sir Hugh.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: Well, fare you well. We shall have the freer wooing at Master Page’s.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Go home, John Rugby, I come anon.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Farewell, my hearts. I will to my honest knight Falstaff, and drink canary with him.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: I think I shall drink in pipe-wine first with him; I’ll make him dance.—Will you go, gentles?

speech.speaker: ALL.
speech.line: Have with you to see this monster.

scene.scenepersonae: (Mistress Ford, Mistress Page, Servants, Robin, Falstaff, Ford, Page, Caius, Evans)

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: What, John! What, Robert!

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Quickly, quickly! Is the buck-basket—

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I warrant. What, Robin, I say!

scene.stagedir: Enter Servants with a great buck-basket.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Come, come, come.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Here, set it down.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Give your men the charge, we must be brief.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Marry, as I told you before, John and Robert, be ready here hard by in the brew-house, and when I suddenly call you, come forth, and (without any pause or staggering) take this basket on your shoulders. That done, trudge with it in all haste, and carry it among the whitsters in Datchet-mead, and there empty it in the muddy ditch close by the Thames side.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: You will do it?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I ha’ told them over and over, they lack no direction. Be gone, and come when you are call’d.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Here comes little Robin.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: How now, my eyas-musket, what news with you?

speech.speaker: ROB.
speech.line: My master, Sir John, is come in at your back door, Mistress Ford, and requests your company.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: You little Jack-a-Lent, have you been true to us?

speech.speaker: ROB.
speech.line: Ay, I’ll be sworn. My master knows not of your being here, and hath threat’ned to put me into everlasting liberty if I tell you of it; for he swears he’ll turn me away.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Thou’rt a good boy. This secrecy of thine shall be a tailor to thee, and shall make thee a new doublet and hose. I’ll go hide me.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Do so. Go tell thy master I am alone.
Mistress Page, remember you your cue.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: I warrant thee, if I do not act it, hiss me.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Go to then. We’ll use this unwholesome humidity, this gross wat’ry pumpion. We’ll teach him to know turtles from jays.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: “Have I caught thee, my heavenly jewel?” Why, now let me die, for I have liv’d long enough. This is the period of my ambition. O this blessed hour!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: O sweet Sir John!

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Mistress Ford, I cannot cog, I cannot prate, Mistress Ford. Now shall I sin in my wish: I would thy husband were dead. I’ll speak it before the best lord, I would make thee my lady.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I your lady, Sir John? Alas, I should be a pitiful lady!

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Let the court of France show me such another. I see how thine eye would emulate the diamond. Thou hast the right arch’d beauty of the brow that becomes the ship-tire, the tire-valiant, or any tire of Venetian admittance.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: A plain kerchief, Sir John. My brows become nothing else, nor that well neither.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: By the Lord, thou art a tyrant to say so. Thou wouldst make an absolute courtier, and the firm fixture of thy foot would give an excellent motion to thy gait in a semicircled farthingale. I see what thou wert, if Fortune thy foe were not, Nature thy friend. Come, thou canst not hide it.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Believe me, there’s no such thing in me.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: What made me love thee? Let that persuade thee there’s something extraordinary in thee. Come, I cannot cog and say thou art this and that, like a many of these lisping hawthorn buds, that come like women in men’s apparel, and smell like Bucklersbury in simple time—I cannot; but I love thee, none but thee; and thou deserv’st it.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Do not betray me, sir. I fear you love Mistress Page.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Thou mightst as well say I love to walk by the Counter-gate, which is as hateful to me as the reek of a lime-kill.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Well, heaven knows how I love you, and you shall one day find it.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Keep in that mind, I’ll deserve it.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Nay, I must tell you, so you do; or else I could not be in that mind.

speech.speaker: ROB.
speech.line: Mistress Ford, Mistress Ford! Here’s Mistress Page at the door, sweating, and blowing, and looking wildly, and would needs speak with you presently.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: She shall not see me, I will ensconce me behind the arras.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Pray you do so, she’s a very tattling woman.
What’s the matter? How now?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: O Mistress Ford, what have you done? You’re sham’d, y’ are overthrown, y’ are undone forever!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: What’s the matter, good Mistress Page?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: O well-a-day, Mistress Ford, having an honest man to your husband, to give him such cause of suspicion!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: What cause of suspicion?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: What cause of suspicion? Out upon you! How am I mistook in you!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Why, alas, what’s the matter?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Your husband’s coming hither, woman, with all the officers in Windsor, to search for a gentleman that he says is here now in the house; by your consent to take an ill advantage of his absence. You are undone.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: ’Tis not so, I hope.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Pray heaven it be not so, that you have such a man here; but ’tis most certain your husband’s coming, with half Windsor at his heels, to search for such a one. I come before to tell you. If you know yourself clear, why, I am glad of it; but if you have a friend here, convey, convey him out. Be not amaz’d, call all your senses to you, defend your reputation, or bid farewell to your good life forever.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: What shall I do? There is a gentleman, my dear friend; and I fear not mine own shame so much as his peril. I had rather than a thousand pound he were out of the house.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: For shame, never stand “you had rather” and “you had rather.” Your husband’s here at hand, bethink you of some conveyance. In the house you cannot hide him. O, how have you deceiv’d me! Look, here is a basket; if he be of any reasonable stature, he may creep in here, and throw foul linen upon him, as if it were going to bucking; or—it is whiting-time—send him by your two men to Datchet-mead.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: He’s too big to go in there. What shall I do?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Let me see’t, let me see’t, O, let me see’t! I’ll in, I’ll in. Follow your friend’s counsel. I’ll in.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: What, Sir John Falstaff?
Are these your letters, knight?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: I love thee. Help me away.—Let me creep in here. I’ll never—

scene.stagedir: Goes into the basket; they put clothes over him.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Help to cover your master, boy. Call your men, Mistress Ford. You dissembling knight!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: What, John! Robert! John!
Go take up these clothes here quickly. Where’s the cowl-staff? Look how you drumble! Carry them to the laundress in Datchet-mead; quickly, come.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Pray you come near. If I suspect without cause, why then make sport at me, then let me be your jest, I deserve it. How now? Whither bear you this?

speech.speaker: 1. SERV.
speech.line: To the laundress, forsooth.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Why, what have you to do whither they bear it? You were best meddle with buck-washing.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Buck! I would I could wash myself of the buck! Buck, buck, buck! Ay, buck! I warrant you, buck, and of the season too, it shall appear.
Gentlemen, I have dream’d tonight; I’ll tell you my dream. Here, here, here be my keys. Ascend my chambers, search, seek, find out. I’ll warrant we’ll unkennel the fox. Let me stop this way first.
So, now uncape.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Good Master Ford, be contented. You wrong yourself too much.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: True, Master Page. Up, gentlemen, you shall see sport anon. Follow me, gentlemen.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: This is fery fantastical humors and jealousies.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: By gar, ’tis no the fashion of France; it is not jealous in France.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Nay, follow him, gentlemen, see the issue of his search.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Is there not a double excellency in this?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I know not which pleases me better, that my husband is deceiv’d, or Sir John.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: What a taking was he in when your husband ask’d who was in the basket!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I am half afraid he will have need of washing, so throwing him into the water will do him a benefit.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Hang him, dishonest rascal! I would all of the same strain were in the same distress.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I think my husband hath some special suspicion of Falstaff’s being here, for I never saw him so gross in his jealousy till now.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: I will lay a plot to try that, and we will yet have more tricks with Falstaff. His dissolute disease will scarce obey this medicine.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Shall we send that foolish carrion, Mistress Quickly, to him, and excuse his throwing into the water, and give him another hope, to betray him to another punishment?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: We will do it. Let him be sent for tomorrow, eight a’ clock, to have amends.

scene.stagedir: Enter Ford, Page, Caius, and Evans.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: I cannot find him. May be the knave bragg’d of that he could not compass.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Heard you that?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: You use me well, Master Ford, do you?

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Ay, I do so.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Heaven make you better than your thoughts!

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Amen!

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: You do yourself mighty wrong, Master Ford.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Ay, ay; I must bear it.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: If there be any pody in the house, and in the chambers, and in the coffers, and in the presses, heaven forgive my sins at the day of judgment!

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Be-gar, nor I too; there is no-bodies.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Fie, fie, Master Ford, are you not asham’d? What spirit, what devil suggests this imagination? I would not ha’ your distemper in this kind for the wealth of Windsor Castle.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: ’Tis my fault, Master Page. I suffer for it.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: You suffer for a pad conscience. Your wife is as honest a omans as I will desires among five thousand, and five hundred too.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: By gar, I see ’tis an honest woman.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Well, I promis’d you a dinner. Come, come, walk in the park. I pray you pardon me; I will hereafter make known to you why I have done this. Come, wife, come, Mistress Page, I pray you pardon me; pray heartly pardon me.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Let’s go in, gentlemen, but (trust me) we’ll mock him. I do invite you tomorrow morning to my house to breakfast; after, we’ll a-birding together. I have a fine hawk for the bush. Shall it be so?

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Any thing.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: If there is one, I shall make two in the company.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: If there be one or two, I shall make-a the turd.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Pray you go, Master Page.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: I pray you now remembrance tomorrow on the lousy knave, mine host.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Dat is good, by gar; with all my heart!

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: A lousy knave, to have his gibes and his mockeries!

scene.scenepersonae: (Fenton, Anne Page, Shallow, Slender, Mistress Quickly, Page)

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: I see I cannot get thy father’s love,
Therefore no more turn me to him, sweet Nan.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: Alas, how then?

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: Why, thou must be thyself.
He doth object I am too great of birth,
And that my state being gall’d with my expense,
I seek to heal it only by his wealth.
Besides these, other bars he lays before me,
My riots past, my wild societies,
And tells me ’tis a thing impossible
I should love thee but as a property.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: May be he tells you true.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: No, heaven so speed me in my time to come!
Albeit I will confess thy father’s wealth
Was the first motive that I woo’d thee, Anne;
Yet wooing thee, I found thee of more value
Than stamps in gold, or sums in sealed bags;
And ’tis the very riches of thyself
That now I aim at.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: Gentle Master Fenton,
Yet seek my father’s love, still seek it, sir.
If opportunity and humblest suit
Cannot attain it, why then hark you hither!

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: Break their talk, Mistress Quickly, my kinsman shall speak for himself.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: I’ll make a shaft or a bolt on’t. ’Slid, ’tis but venturing.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: Be not dismay’d.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: No, she shall not dismay me. I care not for that, but that I am afeard.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Hark ye, Master Slender would speak a word with you.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: I come to him.
This is my father’s choice.
O, what a world of vild ill-favor’d faults
Looks handsome in three hundred pounds a year!

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: And how does good Master Fenton? Pray you a word with you.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: She’s coming; to her, coz. O boy, thou hadst a father!

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: I had a father, Mistress Anne, my uncle can tell you good jests of him. Pray you, uncle, tell Mistress Anne the jest how my father stole two geese out of a pen, good uncle.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: Mistress Anne, my cousin loves you.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: Ay, that I do—as well as I love any woman in Gloucestershire.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: He will maintain you like a gentlewoman.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: Ay, that I will, come cut and long-tail, under the degree of a squire.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: He will make you a hundred and fifty pounds jointure.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: Good Master Shallow, let him woo for himself.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: Marry, I thank you for it; I thank you for that good comfort. She calls you, coz. I’ll leave you.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: Now, Master Slender—

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: Now, good Mistress Anne—

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: What is your will?

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: My will? ’Od’s heartlings, that’s a pretty jest indeed! I ne’er made my will yet, I thank heaven. I am not such a sickly creature, I give heaven praise.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: I mean, Master Slender, what would you with me?

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: Truly, for mine own part, I would little or nothing with you. Your father and my uncle hath made motions. If it be my luck, so; if not, happy man be his dole! They can tell you how things go better than I can. You may ask your father, here he comes.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Now, Master Slender. Love him, daughter Anne.
Why, how now? What does Master Fenton here?
You wrong me, sir, thus still to haunt my house.
I told you, sir, my daughter is dispos’d of.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: Nay, Master Page, be not impatient.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Good Master Fenton, come not to my child.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: She is no match for you.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: Sir, will you hear me?

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: No, good Master Fenton.
Come, Master Shallow; come, son Slender, in.
Knowing my mind, you wrong me, Master Fenton.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Speak to Mistress Page.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: Good Mistress Page, for that I love your daughter
In such a righteous fashion as I do,
Perforce, against all checks, rebukes, and manners,
I must advance the colors of my love,
And not retire. Let me have your good will.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: Good mother, do not marry me to yond fool.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: I mean it not, I seek you a better husband.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: That’s my master, Master Doctor.

speech.speaker: ANNE.
speech.line: Alas, I had rather be set quick i’ th’ earth,
And bowl’d to death with turnips!

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Come, trouble not yourself. Good Master Fenton,
I will not be your friend nor enemy.
My daughter will I question how she loves you,
And as I find her, so am I affected.
Till then farewell, sir; she must needs go in,
Her father will be angry.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: Farewell, gentle mistress; farewell, Nan.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: This is my doing now. “Nay,” said I, “will you cast away your child on a fool, and a physician? Look on Master Fenton.” This is my doing.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: I thank thee; and I pray thee, once tonight
Give my sweet Nan this ring. There’s for thy pains.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Now heaven send thee good fortune!

A kind heart he hath. A woman would run through fire and water for such a kind heart. But yet I would my master had Mistress Anne; or I would Master Slender had her; or, in sooth, I would Master Fenton had her. I will do what I can for them all three, for so I have promis’d, and I’ll be as good as my word, but speciously for Master Fenton. Well, I must of another errand to Sir John Falstaff from my two mistresses. What a beast am I to slack it!

scene.scenelocation: A room in the Garter Inn.
scene.scenepersonae: (Falstaff, Bardolph, Mistress Quickly, Ford)

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Bardolph, I say!

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: Here, sir.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Go fetch me a quart of sack, put a toast in’t.

Have I liv’d to be carried in a basket like a barrow of butcher’s offal? And to be thrown in the Thames? Well, and I be serv’d such another trick, I’ll have my brains ta’en out and butter’d, and give them to a dog for a new-year’s gift. The rogues slighted me into the river with as little remorse as they would have drown’d a blind bitch’s puppies, fifteen i’ th’ litter; and you may know by my size that I have a kind of alacrity in sinking; and the bottom were as deep as hell, I should down. I had been drown’d, but that the shore was shelvy and shallow—a death that I abhor; for the water swells a man; and what a thing should I have been when I had been swell’d! I should have been a mountain of mummy.

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: Here’s Mistress Quickly, sir, to speak with you.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Come, let me pour in some sack to the Thames water; for my belly’s as cold as if I had swallow’d snowballs for pills to cool the reins. Call her in.

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: Come in, woman!

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: By your leave; I cry you mercy! Give your worship good morrow.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Take away these chalices. Go, brew me a pottle of sack finely.

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: With eggs, sir?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Simple of itself; I’ll no pullet-sperm in my brewage.
How now?

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Marry, sir, I come to your worship from Mistress Ford.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Mistress Ford? I have had ford enough. I was thrown into the ford; I have my belly full of ford.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Alas the day! Good heart, that was not her fault. She does so take on with her men; they mistook their erection.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: So did I mine, to build upon a foolish woman’s promise.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Well, she laments, sir, for it, that it would yearn your heart to see it. Her husband goes this morning a-birding; she desires you once more to come to her, between eight and nine. I must carry her word quickly. She’ll make you amends, I warrant you.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Well, I will visit her, tell her so. And bid her think what a man is: let her consider his frailty, and then judge of my merit.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: I will tell her.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Do so. Between nine and ten, say’st thou?

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Eight and nine, sir.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Well, be gone; I will not miss her.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Peace be with you, sir.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: I marvel I hear not of Master Brook; he sent me word to stay within. I like his money well. O, here he comes.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Bless you, sir!

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Now, Master Brook, you come to know what hath pass’d between me and Ford’s wife?

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: That indeed, Sir John, is my business.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Master Brook, I will not lie to you. I was at her house the hour she appointed me.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: And sped you, sir?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Very ill-favoredly, Master Brook.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: How so, sir? Did she change her determination?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: No, Master Brook, but the peaking cornuto her husband, Master Brook, dwelling in a continual ’larum of jealousy, comes me in the instant of our encounter, after we had embrac’d, kiss’d, protested, and, as it were, spoke the prologue of our comedy; and at his heels a rabble of his companions, thither provok’d and instigated by his distemper, and, forsooth, to search his house for his wive’s love.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: What? While you were there?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: While I was there.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: And did he search for you, and could not find you?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: You shall hear. As good luck would have it, comes in one Mistress Page; gives intelligence of Ford’s approach; and in her invention, and Ford’s wive’s distraction, they convey’d me into a buck-basket.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: A buck-basket?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: By the Lord, a buck-basket! Ramm’d me in with foul shirts and smocks, socks, foul stockings, greasy napkins, that, Master Brook, there was the rankest compound of villainous smell that ever offended nostril.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: And how long lay you there?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Nay, you shall hear, Master Brook, what I have suffer’d to bring this woman to evil for your good. Being thus cramm’d in the basket, a couple of Ford’s knaves, his hinds, were call’d forth by their mistress to carry me in the name of foul clothes to Datchet-lane. They took me on their shoulders; met the jealous knave their master in the door, who ask’d them once or twice what they had in their basket. I quak’d for fear, lest the lunatic knave would have search’d it; but fate (ordaining he should be a cuckold) held his hand. Well, on went he for a search, and away went I for foul clothes. But mark the sequel, Master Brook. I suffer’d the pangs of three several deaths: first, an intolerable fright, to be detected with a jealious rotten bell-wether; next, to be compass’d like a good bilbo in the circumference of a peck, hilt to point, heel to head; and then to be stopp’d in like a strong distillation with stinking clothes that fretted in their own grease. Think of that—a man of my kidney. Think of that—that am as subject to heat as butter; a man of continual dissolution and thaw. It was a miracle to scape suffocation. And in the height of this bath (when I was more than half stew’d in grease, like a Dutch dish) to be thrown into the Thames, and cool’d, glowing-hot, in that surge, like a horse-shoe; think of that—hissing-hot—think of that, Master Brook.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: In good sadness, sir, I am sorry that for my sake you have suffer’d all this. My suit then is desperate; You’ll undertake her no more?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Master Brook, I will be thrown into Etna, as I have been into Thames, ere I will leave her thus. Her husband is this morning gone a-birding. I have receiv’d from her another ambassy of meeting. ’Twixt eight and nine is the hour, Master Brook.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: ’Tis past eight already, sir.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Is it? I will then address me to my appointment. Come to me at your convenient leisure, and you shall know how I speed; and the conclusion shall be crown’d with your enjoying her. Adieu. You shall have her, Master Brook. Master Brook, you shall cuckold Ford.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Hum! Ha? Is this a vision? Is this a dream? Do I sleep? Master Ford, awake! Awake, Master Ford! There’s a hole made in your best coat, Master Ford. This ’tis to be married! This ’tis to have linen and buck-baskets! Well, I will proclaim myself what I am. I will now take the lecher; he is at my house. He cannot scape me; ’tis impossible he should; he cannot creep into a halfpenny purse, nor into a pepper-box. But lest the devil that guides him should aid him, I will search impossible places. Though what I am I cannot avoid, yet to be what I would not shall not make me tame. If I have horns to make one mad, let the proverb go with me: I’ll be horn-mad.

scene.scenepersonae: (Mistress Page, Mistress Quickly, William, Evans)
scene.stagedir: Enter Mistress Page, Mistress Quickly, William.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Is he at Master Ford’s already, think’st thou?

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Sure he is by this—or will be presently. But truly he is very courageous mad about his throwing into the water. Mistress Ford desires you to come suddenly.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: I’ll be with her by and by; I’ll but bring my young man here to school.
Look where his master comes; ’tis a playing-day, I see. How now, Sir Hugh, no school today?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: No; Master Slender is let the boys leave to play.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Blessing of his heart!

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Sir Hugh, my husband says my son profits nothing in the world at his book. I pray you ask him some questions in his accidence.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Come hither, William; hold up your head; come.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Come on, sirrah; hold up your head. Answer your master, be not afraid.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: William, how many numbers is in nouns?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Two.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Truly, I thought there had been one number more, because they say, “’Od’s nouns.”

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Peace your tattlings! What is “fair,” William?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Pulcher.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Poulcats? There are fairer things than poulcats sure.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: You are a very simplicity oman; I pray you peace. What is lapis, William?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: A stone.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: And what is ‘a stone,’ William?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: A pebble.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: No; it is lapis. I pray you remember in your prain.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Lapis.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: That is a good William. What is he, William, that does lend articles?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Articles are borrow’d of the pronoun, and be thus declin’d, Singulariter, nominativo, hic, haec, hoc.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Nominativo, hig, hag, hog; pray you mark; genitivo, hujus. Well, what is your accusative case?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Accusativo, hinc.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: I pray you have your remembrance, child. Accusativo, hung, hang, hog.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: “Hang-hog” is Latin for bacon, I warrant you.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Leave your prabbles, oman. What is the focative case, William?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: O—vocativo, O.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Remember, William, focative is caret.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: And that’s a good root.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Oman, forbear.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Peace!

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: What is your genitive case plural, William?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Genitive case?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Ay.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Genitivo, horum, harum, horum.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Vengeance of Jinny’s case! Fie on her! Never name her, child, if she be a whore.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: For shame, oman.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: You do ill to teach the child such words. He teaches him to “hic” and to “hac,” which they’ll do fast enough of themselves, and to call “horum,”—fie upon you!

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Oman, art thou lunatics? Hast thou no understandings for thy cases and the numbers of the genders? Thou art as foolish Christian creatures as I would desires.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Prithee hold thy peace.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Show me now, William, some declensions of your pronouns.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Forsooth, I have forgot.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: It is qui, quae, quod: if you forget your qui’s, your quae’s, and your quod’s, you must be preeches. Go your ways and play, go.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: He is a better scholar than I thought he was.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: He is a good sprag memory. Farewell, Mistress Page.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Adieu, good Sir Hugh.
Get you home, boy. Come, we stay too long.

scene.scenepersonae: (Falstaff, Mistress Ford, Mistress Page, Servants, Ford, Page, Caius, Evans, Shallow)

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Mistress Ford, your sorrow hath eaten up my sufferance. I see you are obsequious in your love, and I profess requital to a hair’s breadth, not only, Mistress Ford, in the simple office of love, but in all the accoutrement, complement, and ceremony of it. But are you sure of your husband now?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: He’s a-birding, sweet Sir John.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: What ho, gossip Ford! What ho!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Step into th’ chamber, Sir John.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: How now, sweet heart, who’s at home besides yourself?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Why, none but mine own people.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Indeed?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: No, certainly.
Speak louder.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Truly, I am so glad you have nobody here.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Why?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Why, woman, your husband is in his old lines again. He so takes on yonder with my husband; so rails against all married mankind; so curses all Eve’s daughters, of what complexion soever; and so buffets himself on the forehead, crying, “Peer out, peer out!” , that any madness I ever yet beheld seem’d but tameness, civility, and patience to this his distemper he is in now. I am glad the fat knight is not here.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Why, does he talk of him?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Of none but him, and swears he was carried out, the last time he search’d for him, in a basket; protests to my husband he is now here, and hath drawn him and the rest of their company from their sport, to make another experiment of his suspicion. But I am glad the knight is not here. Now he shall see his own foolery.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: How near is he, Mistress Page?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Hard by, at street end; he will be here anon.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I am undone! The knight is here.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Why then you are utterly sham’d, and he’s but a dead man. What a woman are you? Away with him, away with him! Better shame than murder.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Which way should he go? How should I bestow him? Shall I put him into the basket again?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: No, I’ll come no more i’ th’ basket. May I not go out ere he come?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Alas! Three of Master Ford’s brothers watch the door with pistols, that none shall issue out; otherwise you might slip away ere he came. But what make you here?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: What shall I do? I’ll creep up into the chimney.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: There they always use to discharge their birding-pieces. Creep into the kill-hole.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Where is it?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: He will seek there, on my word. Neither press, coffer, chest, trunk, well, vault, but he hath an abstract for the remembrance of such places, and goes to them by his note. There is no hiding you in the house.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: I’ll go out then.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: If you go out in your own semblance, you die, Sir John—unless you go out disguis’d.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: How might we disguise him?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Alas the day, I know not! There is no woman’s gown big enough for him; otherwise he might put on a hat, a muffler, and a kerchief, and so escape.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Good hearts, devise something; any extremity rather than a mischief.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: My maid’s aunt, the fat woman of Brainford, has a gown above.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: On my word, it will serve him; she’s as big as he is. And there’s her thrumm’d hat and her muffler too. Run up, Sir John.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Go, go, sweet Sir John. Mistress Page and I will look some linen for your head.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Quick, quick! We’ll come dress you straight. Put on the gown the while.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I would my husband would meet him in this shape. He cannot abide the old woman of Brainford. He swears she’s a witch, forbade her my house, and hath threat’ned to beat her.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Heaven guide him to thy husband’s cudgel; and the devil guide his cudgel afterwards!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: But is my husband coming?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Ay, in good sadness, is he, and talks of the basket too, howsoever he hath had intelligence.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: We’ll try that; for I’ll appoint my men to carry the basket again, to meet him at the door with it, as they did last time.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Nay, but he’ll be here presently. Let’s go dress him like the witch of Brainford.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I’ll first direct my men what they shall do with the basket. Go up, I’ll bring linen for him straight.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Hang him, dishonest varlet! We cannot misuse him enough.
We’ll leave a proof, by that which we will do,
Wives may be merry, and yet honest too:
We do not act that often jest and laugh;
’Tis old, but true: still swine eats all the draff.

scene.stagedir: Enter Mistress Ford with two Servants.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Go, sirs, take the basket again on your shoulders. Your master is hard at door. If he bid you set it down, obey him. Quickly, dispatch.

speech.speaker: 1. SERV.
speech.line: Come, come, take it up.

speech.speaker: 2. SERV.
speech.line: Pray heaven it be not full of knight again.

speech.speaker: 1. SERV.
speech.line: I hope not, I had lief as bear so much lead.

scene.stagedir: Enter Ford, Page, Caius, Evans, Shallow.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Ay, but if it prove true, Master Page, have you any way then to unfool me again? Set down the basket, villain! Somebody call my wife. Youth in a basket! O you panderly rascals, there’s a knot, a ging, a pack, a conspiracy against me. Now shall the devil be sham’d. What, wife, I say! Come, come forth! Behold what honest clothes you send forth to bleaching!

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Why, this passes, Master Ford. You are not to go loose any longer, you must be pinion’d.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Why, this is lunatics! This is mad as a mad dog!

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: Indeed, Master Ford, this is not well indeed.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: So say I too, sir.
Come hither, Mistress Ford, Mistress Ford, the honest woman, the modest wife, the virtuous creature, that hath the jealious fool to her husband! I suspect without cause, mistress, do I?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Heaven be my witness you do, and if you suspect me in any dishonesty.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Well said, brazen-face! Hold it out. Come forth, sirrah!

scene.stagedir: Pulling clothes out of the basket.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: This passes!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Are you not asham’d? Let the clothes alone.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: I shall find you anon.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: ’Tis unreasonable! Will you take up your wive’s clothes? Come away.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Empty the basket, I say!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Why, man, why?

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Master Page, as I am a man, there was one convey’d out of my house yesterday in this basket. Why may not he be there again? In my house I am sure he is. My intelligence is true, my jealousy is reasonable. Pluck me out all the linen.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: If you find a man there, he shall die a flea’s death.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Here’s no man.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: By my fidelity, this is not well, Master Ford; this wrongs you.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Master Ford, you must pray, and not follow the imaginations of your own heart. This is jealousies.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Well, he’s not here I seek for.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: No, nor no where else but in your brain.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Help to search my house this one time. If I find not what I seek, show no color for my extremity; let me forever be your table-sport. Let them say of me, “As jealous as Ford, that search’d a hollow walnut for his wive’s leman.” Satisfy me once more, once more search with me.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: What ho, Mistress Page! Come you and the old woman down; my husband will come into the chamber.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Old woman? What old woman’s that?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Why, it is my maid’s aunt of Brainford.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: A witch, a quean, an old cozening quean! Have I not forbid her my house? She comes of errands, does she? We are simple men, we do not know what’s brought to pass under the profession of fortune-telling. She works by charms, by spells, by th’ figure, and such daub’ry as this is, beyond our element; we know nothing. Come down, you witch, you hag you, come down, I say!

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Nay, good, sweet husband! Good gentlemen, let him not strike the old woman.

scene.stagedir: Enter Falstaff disguised like an old woman, and Mistress Page with him.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Come, Mother Prat, come give me your hand.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: I’ll prat her. Out of my door, you witch, you rag, you baggage, you poulcat, you runnion! Out, out! I’ll conjure you, I’ll fortune-tell you!

scene.stagedir: Ford beats him, and he runs away.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Are you not asham’d? I think you have kill’d the poor woman.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Nay, he will do it.—’Tis a goodly credit for you.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Hang her, witch!

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: By yea and no, I think the oman is a witch indeed. I like not when a oman has a great peard. I spy a great peard under his muffler.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Will you follow, gentlemen? I beseech you follow; see but the issue of my jealousy. If I cry out thus upon no trail, never trust me when I open again.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Let’s obey his humor a little further. Come, gentlemen.

scene.stagedir: Exeunt Ford, Page, Shallow, Caius, and Evans.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Trust me, he beat him most pitifully.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Nay, by th’ mass, that he did not; he beat him most unpitifully, methought.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: I’ll have the cudgel hallow’d and hung o’er the altar; it hath done meritorious service.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: What think you? May we, with the warrant of womanhood and the witness of a good conscience, pursue him with any further revenge?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: The spirit of wantonness is sure scar’d out of him. If the devil have him not in fee-simple, with fine and recovery, he will never, I think, in the way of waste, attempt us again.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Shall we tell our husbands how we have serv’d him?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Yes, by all means; if it be but to scrape the figures out of your husband’s brains. If they can find in their hearts the poor unvirtuous fat knight shall be any further afflicted, we two will still be the ministers.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: I’ll warrant they’ll have him publicly sham’d, and methinks there would be no period to the jest, should he not be publicly sham’d.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Come, to the forge with it, then shape it. I would not have things cool.

scene.scenelocation: A room in the Garter Inn.
scene.scenepersonae: (Host, Bardolph)

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: Sir, the Germans desire to have three of your horses. The Duke himself will be tomorrow at court, and they are going to meet him.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: What duke should that be comes so secretly? I hear not of him in the court. Let me speak with the gentlemen; they speak English?

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: Ay, sir; I’ll call them to you.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: They shall have my horses, but I’ll make them pay; I’ll sauce them. They have had my house a week at command. I have turn’d away my other guests; they must come off. I’ll sauce them, come.

scene.scenepersonae: (Page, Ford, Mistress Page, Mistress Ford, Evans)
scene.stagedir: Enter Page, Ford, Mistress Page, Mistress Ford, and Evans.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: ’Tis one of the best discretions of a oman as ever I did look upon.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: And did he send you both these letters at an instant?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Within a quarter of an hour.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Pardon me, wife, henceforth do what thou wilt.
I rather will suspect the sun with cold
Than thee with wantonness. Now doth thy honor stand,
In him that was of late an heretic,
As firm as faith.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: ’Tis well, ’tis well, no more.
Be not as extreme in submission as in offense;
But let our plot go forward. Let our wives
Yet once again (to make us public sport)
Appoint a meeting with this old fat fellow,
Where we may take him, and disgrace him for it.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: There is no better way than that they spoke of.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: How? To send him word they’ll meet him in the park at midnight? Fie, fie, he’ll never come.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: You say he has been thrown in the rivers, and has been grievously peaten as an old oman. Methinks there should be terrors in him that he should not come; methinks his flesh is punish’d, he shall have no desires.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: So think I too.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Devise but how You’ll use him when he comes,
And let us two devise to bring him thither.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: There is an old tale goes, that Herne the Hunter
(Sometime a keeper here in Windsor forest)
Doth all the winter-time, at still midnight,
Walk round about an oak, with great ragg’d horns,
And there he blasts the tree, and takes the cattle,
And makes milch-kine yield blood, and shakes a chain
In a most hideous and dreadful manner.
You have heard of such a spirit, and well you know
The superstitious idle-headed eld
Receiv’d and did deliver to our age
This tale of Herne the Hunter for a truth.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Why, yet there want not many that do fear
In deep of night to walk by this Herne’s oak.
But what of this?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Marry, this is our device:
That Falstaff at that oak shall meet with us,
Disguis’d like Herne, with huge horns on his head.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Well, let it not be doubted but he’ll come,
And in this shape when you have brought him thither,
What shall be done with him? What is your plot?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: That likewise have we thought upon, and thus:
Nan Page (my daughter) and my little son,
And three or four more of their growth, we’ll dress
Like urchins, ouphes, and fairies, green and white,
With rounds of waxen tapers on their heads,
And rattles in their hands. Upon a sudden,
As Falstaff, she, and I are newly met,
Let them from forth a sawpit rush at once
With some diffused song. Upon their sight,
We two in great amazedness will fly;
Then let them all encircle him about,
And fairy-like to pinch the unclean knight;
And ask him why, that hour of fairy revel,
In their so sacred paths he dares to tread
In shape profane.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: And till he tell the truth,
Let the supposed fairies pinch him sound,
And burn him with their tapers.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: The truth being known,
We’ll all present ourselves; dis-horn the spirit,
And mock him home to Windsor.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: The children must
Be practic’d well to this, or they’ll nev’r do’t.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: I will teach the children their behaviors; and I will be like a jack-an-apes also, to burn the knight with my taber.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: That will be excellent. I’ll go buy them vizards.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: My Nan shall be the queen of all the fairies,
Finely attired in a robe of white.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: That silk will I go buy.
And in that time
Shall Master Slender steal my Nan away,
And marry her at Eton.—Go, send to Falstaff straight.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Nay, I’ll to him again in name of Brook;
He’ll tell me all his purpose. Sure he’ll come.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Fear not you that. Go get us properties
And tricking for our fairies.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Let us about it. It is admirable pleasures and fery honest knaveries.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Go, Mistress Ford,
Send Quickly to Sir John, to know his mind.
I’ll to the doctor, he hath my good will,
And none but he, to marry with Nan Page.
That Slender (though well landed) is an idiot;
And he my husband best of all affects.
The doctor is well money’d, and his friends
Potent at court. He, none but he, shall have her,
Though twenty thousand worthier come to crave her.

scene.scenelocation: A room in the Garter Inn.
scene.scenepersonae: (Host, Simple, Falstaff, Bardolph, Evans, Caius, Mistress Quickly)

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: What wouldst thou have, boor? What, thick-skin? Speak, breathe, discuss; brief, short, quick, snap.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: Marry, sir, I come to speak with Sir John Falstaff from Master Slender.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: There’s his chamber, his house, his castle, his standing-bed and truckle-bed; ’tis painted about with the story of the Prodigal, fresh and new. Go, knock and call; he’ll speak like an Anthropophaginian unto thee. Knock, I say.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: There’s an old woman, a fat woman, gone up into his chamber. I’ll be so bold as stay, sir, till she come down. I come to speak with her indeed.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Ha? A fat woman? The knight may be robb’d. I’ll call. Bully-knight! Bully Sir John! Speak from thy lungs military. Art thou there? It is thine host, thine Ephesian, calls.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: How now, mine host?

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Here’s a Bohemian-Tartar tarries the coming down of thy fat woman. Let her descend, bully, let her descend; my chambers are honorable. Fie, privacy? Fie!

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: There was, mine host, an old fat woman even now with me, but she’s gone.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: Pray you, sir, was’t not the wise woman of Brainford?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Ay, marry, was it, mussel-shell, what would you with her?

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: My master, sir, my Master Slender, sent to her, seeing her go thorough the streets, to know, sir, whether one Nym, sir, that beguil’d him of a chain, had the chain or no.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: I spake with the old woman about it.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: And what says she, I pray, sir?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Marry, she says that the very same man that beguil’d Master Slender of his chain cozen’d him of it.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: I would I could have spoken with the woman herself. I had other things to have spoken with her too from him.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: What are they? Let us know.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Ay; come; quick.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: I may not conceal them, sir.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Conceal them, or thou diest.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: Why, sir, they were nothing but about Mistress Anne Page, to know if it were my master’s fortune to have her or no.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: ’Tis, ’tis his fortune.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: What, sir?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: To have her, or no. Go; say the woman told me so.

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: May I be bold to say so, sir?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Ay, sir; like who more bold?

speech.speaker: SIM.
speech.line: I thank your worship. I shall make my master glad with these tidings.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Thou art clerkly, thou art clerkly, Sir John. Was there a wise woman with thee?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Ay, that there was, mine host, one that hath taught me more wit than ever I learn’d before in my life; and I paid nothing for it neither, but was paid for my learning.

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: Out alas, sir, cozenage! Mere cozenage.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Where be my horses? Speak well of them, varletto.

speech.speaker: BARD.
speech.line: Run away with the cozeners; for so soon as I came beyond Eton, they threw me off from behind one of them, in a slough of mire; and set spurs and away, like three German devils, three Doctor Faustuses.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: They are gone but to meet the Duke, villain, do not say they be fled. Germans are honest men.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Where is mine host?

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: What is the matter, sir?

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Have a care of your entertainments. There is a friend of mine come to town, tells me there is three cozen-germans that has cozen’d all the hosts of Readins, of Maidenhead, of Colebrook, of horses and money. I tell you for good will, look you. You are wise and full of gibes and vlouting-stocks, and ’tis not convenient you should be cozen’d. Fare you well.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: Vere is mine host de Jarteer?

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Here, Master Doctor, in perplexity and doubtful dilemma.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: I cannot tell vat is dat; but it is tell-a me dat you make grand preparation for a duke de Jamany. By my trot, dere is no duke that the court is know to come. I tell you for good will; adieu.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Hue and cry, villain, go! Assist me, knight, I am undone! Fly, run, hue and cry, villain! I am undone!

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: I would all the world might be cozen’d, for I have been cozen’d and beaten too. If it should come to the ear of the court, how I have been transform’d, and how my transformation hath been wash’d and cudgell’d, they would melt me out of my fat drop by drop, and liquor fishermen’s boots with me. I warrant they would whip me with their fine wits till I were as crestfall’n as a dried pear. I never prosper’d since I forswore myself at primero. Well, if my wind were but long enough to say my prayers, I would repent.
Now? Whence come you?

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: From the two parties, forsooth.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: The devil take one party and his dam the other! And so they shall be both bestow’d. I have suffer’d more for their sakes—more than the villainous inconstancy of man’s disposition is able to bear.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: And have not they suffer’d? Yes, I warrant; speciously one of them. Mistress Ford, good heart, is beaten black and blue, that you cannot see a white spot about her.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: What tellest thou me of black and blue? I was beaten myself into all the colors of the rainbow; and I was like to be apprehended for the witch of Brainford. But that my admirable dexterity of wit, my counterfeiting the action of an old woman, deliver’d me, the knave constable had set me i’ th’ stocks, i’ th’ common stocks, for a witch.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Sir—let me speak with you in your chamber. You shall hear how things go, and, I warrant, to your content. Here is a letter will say somewhat. Good hearts, what ado here is to bring you together! Sure, one of you does not serve heaven well, that you are so cross’d.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Come up into my chamber.

scene.scenelocation: Another room in the Garter Inn.
scene.scenepersonae: (Fenton, Host)

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Master Fenton, talk not to me, my mind is heavy; I will give over all.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: Yet hear me speak. Assist me in my purpose,
And (as I am a gentleman) I’ll give thee
A hundred pound in gold more than your loss.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: I will hear you, Master Fenton, and I will (at the least) keep your counsel.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: From time to time I have acquainted you
With the dear love I bear to fair Anne Page,
Who mutually hath answer’d my affection
(So far forth as herself might be her chooser)
Even to my wish. I have a letter from her
Of such contents as you will wonder at;
The mirth whereof so larded with my matter,
That neither, singly, can be manifested
Without the show of both. Fat Falstaff
Hath a great scene; the image of the jest
I’ll show you here at large. Hark, good mine host:
Tonight at Herne’s oak, just ’twixt twelve and one,
Must my sweet Nan present the Fairy Queen;
The purpose why, is here; in which disguise,
While other jests are something rank on foot,
Her father hath commanded her to slip
Away with Slender, and with him at Eton
Immediately to marry. She hath consented.
Now, sir,
Her mother (even strong against that match
And firm for Doctor Caius) hath appointed
That he shall likewise shuffle her away,
While other sports are tasking of their minds,
And at the dean’ry, where a priest attends,
Straight marry her. To this her mother’s plot
She (seemingly obedient) likewise hath
Made promise to the doctor. Now, thus it rests:
Her father means she shall be all in white;
And in that habit, when Slender sees his time
To take her by the hand and bid her go,
She shall go with him. Her mother hath intended
(The better to denote her to the doctor,
For they must all be mask’d and vizarded)
That quaint in green she shall be loose enrob’d,
With ribands pendant, flaring ’bout her head;
And when the doctor spies his vantage ripe,
To pinch her by the hand, and on that token,
The maid hath given consent to go with him.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Which means she to deceive, father or mother?

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: Both, my good host, to go along with me.
And here it rests, that You’ll procure the vicar
To stay for me at church, ’twixt twelve and one,
And in the lawful name of marrying,
To give our hearts united ceremony.

speech.speaker: HOST.
speech.line: Well, husband your device; I’ll to the vicar.
Bring you the maid, you shall not lack a priest.

speech.speaker: FENT.
speech.line: So shall I evermore be bound to thee;
Besides, I’ll make a present recompense.

scene.scenelocation: A room in the Garter Inn.
scene.scenepersonae: (Falstaff, Mistress Quickly, Ford)

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Prithee no more prattling. Go, I’ll hold. This is the third time; I hope good luck lies in odd numbers. Away, go. They say there is divinity in odd numbers, either in nativity, chance, or death. Away!

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: I’ll provide you a chain, and I’ll do what I can to get you a pair of horns.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Away, I say, time wears, hold up your head and mince.
How now, Master Brook? Master Brook, the matter will be known tonight, or never. Be you in the park about midnight, at Herne’s oak, and you shall see wonders.

speech.speaker: FORD.
speech.line: Went you not to her yesterday, sir, as you told me you had appointed?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: I went to her, Master Brook, as you see, like a poor old man, but I came from her, Master Brook, like a poor old woman. That same knave Ford, her husband, hath the finest mad devil of jealousy in him, Master Brook, that ever govern’d frenzy. I will tell you—he beat me grievously, in the shape of a woman; for in the shape of man, Master Brook, I fear not Goliah with a weaver’s beam, because I know also life is a shuttle. I am in haste, go along with me, I’ll tell you all, Master Brook. Since I pluck’d geese, play’d truant, and whipt top, I knew not what ’twas to be beaten till lately. Follow me, I’ll tell you strange things of this knave Ford, on whom tonight I will be reveng’d, and I will deliver his wife into your hand. Follow. Strange things in hand, Master Brook! Follow.

scene.scenepersonae: (Page, Shallow, Slender)

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: Come, come; we’ll couch i’ th’ castle-ditch till we see the light of our fairies. Remember, son Slender, my daughter.

speech.speaker: SLEN.
speech.line: Ay, forsooth, I have spoke with her, and we have a nay-word how to know one another. I come to her in white, and cry “mum”; she cries “budget”; and by that we know one another.

speech.speaker: SHAL.
speech.line: That’s good too; but what needs either your “mum” or her “budget”? The white will decipher her well enough. It hath strook ten a’ clock.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
speech.line: The night is dark, light and spirits will become it well. Heaven prosper our sport! No man means evil but the devil, and we shall know him by his horns. Let’s away; follow me.

scene.scenelocation: A street leading to the Park.
scene.scenepersonae: (Mistress Page, Mistress Ford, Caius)
scene.stagedir: Enter Mistress Page, Mistress Ford, Caius.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Master Doctor, my daughter is in green. When you see your time, take her by the hand, away with her to the deanery, and dispatch it quickly. Go before into the park; we two must go together.

speech.speaker: CAIUS.
speech.line: I know vat I have to do. Adieu.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Fare you well, sir.
My husband will not rejoice so much at the abuse of Falstaff as he will chafe at the doctor’s marrying my daughter. But ’tis no matter; better a little chiding than a great deal of heart-break.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Where is Nan now, and her troop of fairies, and the Welsh devil Hugh?

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: They are all couch’d in a pit hard by Herne’s oak, with obscur’d lights; which, at the very instant of Falstaff’s and our meeting, they will at once display to the night.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: That cannot choose but amaze him.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: If he be not amaz’d, he will be mock’d; if he be amaz’d, he will every way be mock’d.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: We’ll betray him finely.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Against such lewdsters, and their lechery,
Those that betray them do no treachery.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: The hour draws on. To the oak, to the oak!

scene.scenepersonae: (Evans, Children of Windsor, Boy, Postmaster’s Boy)
scene.stagedir: Enter Evans like a satyr and others as fairies.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Trib, trib, fairies; come, and remember your parts. Be pold, I pray you. Follow me into the pit, and when I give the watch-ords, do as I pid you. Come, come, trib, trib.

scene.scenepersonae: (Falstaff, Mistress Page, Mistress Ford, Evans, Pistol, Mistress Quickly, Doctor Caius, Slender, Fenton, Page, Ford, Children of Windsor, Boy, Postmaster’s Boy)
scene.stagedir: Enter Falstaff with a buck’s head upon him.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: The Windsor bell hath strook twelve; the minute draws on. Now the hot-bloodied gods assist me! Remember, Jove, thou wast a bull for thy Europa, love set on thy horns. O powerful love, that in some respects makes a beast a man; in some other, a man a beast. You were also, Jupiter, a swan for the love of Leda. O omnipotent love, how near the god drew to the complexion of a goose! A fault done first in the form of a beast (O Jove, a beastly fault!) and then another fault in the semblance of a fowl—think on’t, Jove, a foul fault! When gods have hot backs, what shall poor men do? For me, I am here a Windsor stag, and the fattest, I think, i’ th’ forest. Send me a cool rut-time, Jove, or who can blame me to piss my tallow? Who comes here? My doe?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Sir John? Art thou there, my deer? My male deer?

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: My doe with the black scut? Let the sky rain potatoes; let it thunder to the tune of “Green-sleeves,” hail kissing-comfits, and snow eringoes; let there come a tempest of provocation, I will shelter me here.

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Mistress Page is come with me, sweet heart.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Divide me like a brib’d-buck, each a haunch. I will keep my sides to myself, my shoulders for the fellow of this walk—and my horns I bequeath your husbands. Am I a woodman, ha? Speak I like Herne the hunter? Why, now is Cupid a child of conscience, he makes restitution. As I am a true spirit, welcome!

scene.stagedir: There is a noise of horns.

speech.speaker: MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Alas, what noise?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD.
speech.line: Heaven forgive our sins!

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: What should this be?

speech.speaker: MRS. FORD, MRS. PAGE.
speech.line: Away, away!

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: I think the devil will not have me damn’d, lest the oil that’s in me should set hell on fire; he would never else cross me thus.

scene.stagedir: Enter Evans like a satyr, Anne Page and Boys dressed like fairies, Pistol as Hobgoblin, Mistress Quickly like the Queen of Fairies; they sing a song about him and afterward speak.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Fairies, black, grey, green, and white,
You moonshine revellers, and shades of night,
You orphan heirs of fixed destiny,
Attend your office and your quality.
Crier Hobgoblin, make the fairy Oyes.

speech.speaker: PIST.
speech.line: Elves, list your names; silence, you aery toys!
Cricket, to Windsor chimneys shalt thou leap;
Where fires thou find’st unrak’d and hearths unswept,
There pinch the maids as blue as bilberry;
Our radiant Queen hates sluts and sluttery.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: They are fairies, he that speaks to them shall die.
I’ll wink and couch; no man their works must eye.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Where’s Bede? Go you, and where you find a maid
That ere she sleep has thrice her prayers said,
Raise up the organs of her fantasy,
Sleep she as sound as careless infancy;
But those as sleep and think not on their sins,
Pinch them, arms, legs, backs, shoulders, sides, and shins.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: About, about;
Search Windsor Castle, elves, within and out.
Strew good luck, ouphes, on every sacred room,
That it may stand till the perpetual doom
In state as wholesome as in state ’tis fit,
Worthy the owner, and the owner it.
The several chairs of order look you scour
With juice of balm and every precious flow’r;
Each fair installment, coat, and sev’ral crest,
With loyal blazon, evermore be blest!
And nightly, meadow-fairies, look you sing,
Like to the Garter’s compass, in a ring.
Th’ expressure that it bears, green let it be,
More fertile-fresh than all the field to see;
And “Honi soit qui mal y pense” write
In em’rald tuffs, flow’rs purple, blue, and white,
Like sapphire, pearl, and rich embroidery,
Buckled below fair knighthood’s bending knee:
Fairies use flow’rs for their charactery.
Away, disperse! But till ’tis one a’ clock,
Our dance of custom, round about the oak
Of Herne the hunter, let us not forget.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Pray you lock hand in hand; yourselves in order set;
And twenty glow-worms shall our lanthorns be,
To guide our measure round about the tree.
But stay, I smell a man of middle-earth.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: Heavens defend me from that Welsh fairy, lest he transform me to a piece of cheese!

speech.speaker: PIST.
speech.line: Vild worm, thou wast o’erlook’d even in thy birth.

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: With trial-fire touch me his finger-end.
If he be chaste, the flame will back descend
And turn him to no pain; but if he start,
It is the flesh of a corrupted heart.

speech.speaker: PIST.
speech.line: A trial, come.

speech.speaker: EVANS.
speech.line: Come, will this wood take fire?

scene.stagedir: They put the tapers to his fingers, and he starts.

speech.speaker: FAL.
speech.line: O, O, O!

speech.speaker: QUICK.
speech.line: Corrupt, corrupt, and tainted in desire!
About him, fairies, sing a scornful rhyme,
And as you trip, still pinch him to your time.
Fie on sinful fantasy!
Fie on lust and luxury!
Lust is but a bloody fire,
Kindled with unchaste desire,
Fed in heart, whose flames aspire,
As thoughts do blow them, higher and higher.
Pinch him, fairies, mutually!
Pinch him for his villainy!
Pinch him, and burn him, and turn him about,
Till candles, and starlight, and moonshine be out.

scene.stagedir: Here they pinch him and sing about him. And the Doctor Caius comes one way, and steals away a boy in green; and Slender another way; he takes a boy in white; and Fenton steals Mistress Anne Page. And a noise of hunting is made within; and all the fairies run away. Falstaff pulls off his buck’s head, and rises up.
Enter Page, Ford, Mistress Page, and Mistress Ford.

speech.speaker: PAGE.
